body:
> Hi,
> 
> The WordGCN is an interesting thing. However, I can't compile the batch_generator.cpp with the command "make" following the Readme on Ubuntu 18.04 Lts. Meanwhile, the requirements can not be found in the repository.
> 
> **g++ batch_generator.cpp -o batchGen.so -fPIC -shared -pthread -O3 -march=native -std=c++11 batch_generator.cpp:96:3: error: expected identifier before ‘)’ token ) { ^ makefile:2: recipe for target 'all' failed make: *** [all] Error 1**
> 
> Thanks.

Hi @hjpwhu,
Thank you for pointing out the error. I have corrected it, please do `git pull` and try once again.

> Hi @hjpwhu,
> Thank you for pointing out the error. I have corrected it, please do `git pull` and try once again.

Hi @svjan5,
Thank you for your reply, and the "make" command can work. However, when I run "python syngcn.py -name test_embeddings -gpu 0" in terminal on Ubuntu 18.04 with TensorFlow 1.90, I got the following information, can you do me a favor? Thanks.

**/home/hjp/Workspace/Tempshop/Python/Conda/envs/Env36Tf190/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: RuntimeWarning: numpy.dtype size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 96, got 88
  return f(*args, **kwds)
/home/hjp/Workspace/Tempshop/Python/Conda/envs/Env36Tf190/lib/python3.6/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: RuntimeWarning: numpy.dtype size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 96, got 88
  return f(*args, **kwds)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "syngcn.py", line 5, in <module>
    from web.embedding import Embedding
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'web'**

Hi,
I am sorry for the trouble. The error was because of a missing package: [word-embeddings-benchmark](https://github.com/kudkudak/word-embeddings-benchmarks). I have included that in the readme.md. Once that is installed I think it should work without any problem. Please let me know if you face any difficulty.

**Hi, thank you for your reply. But I find the following information when I run the command "python syngcn.py -name test_embeddings -gpu 0" in terminal:**

(Env36Tf190) hjp@cvnlpserver:~/Downloads/tmp/tmp/tmp/WordGCN$ python syngcn.py -name test_embeddings -gpu 0

Hi,
For me the code is working, at least on Tensorflow CPU version (I didn't try with GPU). It seems like some datafile is missing is your case. Please check whether `data` directory has these four files `data.txt`, `de2id.txt`, `id2freq.txt`, `voc2id.txt`.
Thank you for your time and information.

Hi, when I tried to run semgcn.py,  the following error occurred. It doesn't seem to be the fault of the program itself. 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "semgcn.py", line 606, in <module>
    model = SemGCN(args)
  File "semgcn.py", line 469, in __init__
    nn_out    = self.add_model()
  File "semgcn.py", line 364, in add_model
    adj_mat     = self.adj_mat,         w_gating   = self.p.wGate,              num_layers = self.p.gcn_layer,     name = "GCN")
  File "semgcn.py", line 279, in gcnLayer
    inp_loop = tf.tensordot(gcn_in, w_loop,  axes=[2,0])
  File "/home/yinyiping/software/anaconda3/envs/tf_gpu/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/math_ops.py", line 2452, in tensordot
    a_axes, b_axes = _tensordot_axes(a, axes)
  File "/home/yinyiping/software/anaconda3/envs/tf_gpu/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/math_ops.py", line 2440, in _tensordot_axes
    if len(a_axes) != len(b_axes):
TypeError: object of type 'int' has no len()

Hi @non-swimmer,
Sure, I will look into this. Please wait for a few days.

Hi @non-swimmer,
Please try the updated code. I have removed one small bug in `semgcn.py` file. It should be working now. Thanks for pointing out the error.
